rules.description: Detects hardcoded API keys, secrets, or tokens in source code
rules.recommendation: Use environment variables or secure credential management. Example: api_key = os.getenv('API_KEY') or use AWS Secrets Manager, Azure Key Vault, etc.
rules.message: Hardcoded API keys or secrets in source code can be exposed in version control

rules.description: Detects hardcoded passwords in source code
rules.recommendation: Use environment variables, configuration files (not in version control), or secure credential management services. Example: password = os.getenv('DB_PASSWORD')
rules.message: Hardcoded passwords in source code pose a serious security risk

rules.description: Detects use of weak or broken cryptographic algorithms like MD5, SHA1
rules.recommendation: Use modern cryptographic algorithms: SHA-256, SHA-3, or bcrypt for passwords. Example: hashlib.sha256() or bcrypt.hashpw()
rules.message: Use of weak cryptographic algorithms (MD5, SHA1, DES, RC4) is insecure
